verses.text: In the third year of Cyrus king of Persia a thing was revealed unto Daniel , whose name was called Belteshazzar ; and the thing \add was\add* true , but the time appointed \add was\add* long : and he understood the thing , and had understanding of the vision.\f + \fr 10.1 \ft long: Heb. great\f*
In those days I Daniel was mourning three full weeks.\f + \fr 10.2 \ft full…: Heb. weeks of days\f*
I ate no pleasant bread , neither came flesh nor wine in my mouth , neither did I anoint myself at all , till three whole weeks were fulfilled.\f + \fr 10.3 \ft pleasant…: Heb. bread of desires\f*
And in the four and twentieth day of the first month , as I was by the side of the great river , which \add is\add* Hiddekel ;
Then I lifted up mine eyes , and looked , and behold a certain man clothed in linen , whose loins \add were\add* girded with fine gold of Uphaz :\f + \fr 10.5 \ft a…: Heb. one man\f*

His body also \add was\add* like the beryl , and his face as the appearance of lightning , and his eyes as lamps of fire , and his arms and his feet like in colour to polished brass , and the voice of his words like the voice of a multitude.
And I Daniel alone saw the vision : for the men that were with me saw not the vision ; but a great quaking fell upon them, so that they fled to hide themselves.

Therefore I was left alone , and saw this great vision , and there remained no strength in me: for my comeliness was turned in me into corruption , and I retained no strength.\f + \fr 10.8 \ft comeliness: or, vigour\f*
Yet heard I the voice of his words : and when I heard the voice of his words , then was I in a deep sleep on my face , and my face toward the ground. \p
¶ And, behold, an hand touched me, which set me upon my knees and \add upon\add* the palms of my hands.\f + \fr 10.10 \ft set: Heb. moved\f*

And he said unto me, O Daniel , a man greatly beloved , understand the words that I speak unto thee, and stand upright : for unto thee am I now sent. And when he had spoken this word unto me, I stood trembling.\f + \fr 10.11 \ft greatly…: Heb. of desires\f*\f + \fr 10.11 \ft upright: Heb. upon thy standing\f*

Then said he unto me, Fear not, Daniel : for from the first day that thou didst set thine heart to understand , and to chasten thyself before thy God , thy words were heard , and I am come for thy words.

But the prince of the kingdom of Persia withstood me one and twenty days : but, lo, Michael , one of the chief princes , came to help me; and I remained there with the kings of Persia.\f + \fr 10.13 \ft chief: or, first\f*
Now I am come to make thee understand what shall befall thy people in the latter days : for yet the vision \add is\add* for \add many\add* days.
And when he had spoken such words unto me, I set my face toward the ground , and I became dumb.

And, behold, \add one\add* like the similitude of the sons of men touched my lips : then I opened my mouth , and spake , and said unto him that stood before me, O my lord , by the vision my sorrows are turned upon me, and I have retained no strength.

For how can the servant of this my lord talk with this my lord ? for as for me, straightway there remained no strength in me, neither is there breath left in me.\f + \fr 10.17 \ft the…: or, this servant of my lord\f*
Then there came again and touched me \add one\add* like the appearance of a man , and he strengthened me,

And said , O man greatly beloved , fear not: peace \add be\add* unto thee, be strong , yea, be strong. And when he had spoken unto me, I was strengthened , and said , Let my lord speak ; for thou hast strengthened me.
Then said he, Knowest thou wherefore I come unto thee? and now will I return to fight with the prince of Persia : and when I am gone forth , lo, the prince of Grecia shall come.

But I will shew thee that which is noted in the scripture of truth : and \add there is\add* none that holdeth with me in these things, but Michael your prince.\f + \fr 10.21 \ft holdeth: Heb. strengtheneth himself\f*
